books.author: by Laura Hillenbrand
books.description: An Olympic runner’s story of survival as a prisoner of the Japanese in World War II.
books.name: UNBROKEN

books.author: by Dinesh D'Souza
books.description: A defense of America against the view that its power in the world should be diminished; also a documentary film.
books.name: AMERICA

books.author: by Todd Burpo with Lynn Vincent
books.description: A 3-year-old’s encounter with Jesus during an appendectomy; the basis of the movie.
books.name: HEAVEN IS FOR REAL

books.author: by Daniel James Brown
books.description: The University of Washington’s eight-oar crew and their quest for gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympics.
books.name: THE BOYS IN THE BOAT

books.author: by Piper Kerman
books.description: A memoir by a Brooklyn woman whose relationship with a drug runner gets her sentenced to a year in prison. The basis for the Netflix series, originally published in 2010.
books.name: ORANGE IS THE NEW BLACK

books.author: by Edward Klein
books.description: A journalist describes animosity behind the alliance between the Clinton and Obama families.
books.name: BLOOD FEUD

books.author: by Ben Carson with Candy Carson
books.description: Carson, a retired pediatric neurosurgeon, now a Fox News contributor, offers solutions to problems in health and education based on capitalism, not government.
books.name: ONE NATION

books.author: by Hillary Rodham Clinton
books.description: Clinton’s memoir focuses on her years as secretary of state and her views on America’s role in the world.
books.name: HARD CHOICES

books.author: by Marja Mills
books.description: The author’s experience as Harper Lee’s neighbor.
books.name: THE MOCKINGBIRD NEXT DOOR

books.author: by Malcolm Gladwell
books.description: Why some people succeed; from the author of "Blink" and "The Tipping Point."
books.name: OUTLIERS

books.author: by Ben Macintyre
books.description: The British ruse that employed a corpse to fool the Nazis about the invasion of Sicily.
books.name: OPERATION MINCEMEAT

books.author: by Cheryl Strayed
books.description: A woman’s account of a life-changing 1,100-mile hike along the Pacific Crest Trail during the summer of 1995.
books.name: WILD

books.author: by Daniel Halper
books.description: A view of how the family attained, lost and regained political power, from an editor of The Weekly Standard.
books.name: CLINTON, INC.

books.author: by Susan Cain
books.description: Introverts — one-third of the population — are undervalued in American society.
books.name: QUIET

books.author: by Malcolm Gladwell
books.description: How disadvantages can work in our favor; from the author of "The Tipping Point" and "Outliers."
books.name: DAVID AND GOLIATH
